sense.name: study, investigate, or analyze in detail
sense.examples: Forensic scientists are examining the wreckage for clues about the cause of the explosion. The council is to examine ways of reducing traffic in the city centre. The research examined the effects of alcohol on long-term memory. We need to examine how an accident like this can be avoided in the future. The professor examined the structure of a novel in class.

sense.name: inspect something or somebody/look at
sense.examples: The customs agent examined the baggage. He examined the rash on his skin with his eyes. I suggest you get examined by a qualified physician.

sense.name: test someone by questioning; interrogate
sense.examples: Candidates must pass a qualifying test which examines for general and specific knowledge. A psychiatrist was examined on the mental state of the defendant. The prosecutor examined the witness under oath. `
